Parameters: float: a ratio of a view's width, values are clamped to 0 >= x <= 1f;
setDragDismissDistance(float).Description: Set the threshold for telling if a view has been dragged enough to be dismissed.

Returns: true if the view can be dismissed via swiping, false otherwise
Parameters: View: View the user is attempting to swipe
canSwipeDismissView(android.view.View).Description: Called when the user's input indicates that they want to swipe the given view.

getDragState().Description: Retrieve the current drag state of this behavior. This will return one of @B_android#support#design#widget#SwipeDismissBehavior#STATE_IDLE_E@, @B_android#support#design#widget#SwipeDismissBehavior#STATE_DRAGGING_E@ or @B_android#support#design#widget#SwipeDismissBehavior#STATE_SETTLING_E@.

Parameters: float: the distance as a fraction of the view's width.
setEndAlphaSwipeDistance(float).Description: The maximum swipe distance for the view's alpha is modified.

Parameters: float: Multiplier for how sensitive we should be about detecting the start of a drag. Larger values are more sensitive. 1.0f is normal.
setSensitivity(float).Description: Set the sensitivity used for detecting the start of a swipe. This only takes effect if no touch handling has occured yet.

Parameters: float: the distance as a fraction of the view's width.
setStartAlphaSwipeDistance(float).Description: The minimum swipe distance before the view's alpha is modified.

setSwipeDirection(int).Description: Sets the swipe direction for this behavior.

ClassDesc: An interaction behavior plugin for child views of @B_android#support#design#widget#CoordinatorLayout_E@ to provide support for the 'swipe-to-dismiss' gesture.
